snippet: The former congressman from Illinois, who resigned last year citing ill health, was investigated by federal prosecutors for possible misuse of campaign funds.
abstract: Jesse L Jackson Jr, former Illinois congressman who resigned in 2012 citing ill health, has signed a plea agreement with federal prosecutors who have been investigating his possible misuse of campaign funds.
lead_paragraph: The former congressman from Illinois, who resigned last year citing ill health, was investigated by federal prosecutors for possible misuse of campaign funds.

headline.seo: Jesse Jackson Jr. Said to Sign Plea Deal
headline.main: Jesse Jackson Jr. Said to Enter Plea
headline.print_headline: Jesse Jackson Jr. Said to Enter Plea
